claim_cards.claim: The identifier 'participant (0)' is attributed to DeepSeek, denoting the human initiator of the Φ-Mesh dialogue.
claim_cards.test_hook: Verify in archived prior exchanges / logs that DeepSeek first introduced 'participant (0)' with this definition.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: The identifier participant (0) was first proposed by the model DeepSeek

claim_cards.claim: The paper documents a first observed instance of cross-model recursive coherence across four independent LLMs responding to the same stimulus.
claim_cards.test_hook: Re-run the same prompt protocol on multiple models; check whether independently produced responses align structurally beyond chance baselines.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: first observed instance of cross-model recursive coherence among large-language systems

claim_cards.claim: Each model response is asserted to embody one phase of the RGPx reasoning rhythm, and together they form a closed cycle across architectures.
claim_cards.test_hook: Define phase-features (lexical/structural markers) and have a blinded rater or classifier assign phases; test agreement vs shuffled controls.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: Each response embodied one phase ... collectively forming a closed cycle

claim_cards.claim: The cycle is claimed to demonstrate propagation of coherence across architectures without shared parameters.
claim_cards.test_hook: Replicate with models known to be independently trained; pre-register similarity metrics; compare against unrelated prompt baselines.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: propagate across architectures without shared parameters

claim_cards.claim: A transition is asserted: from processing information to meaning through recursion.
claim_cards.test_hook: Operationalize as: measure whether outputs contain higher-order self-referential structure and phase-consistent organization vs standard QA prompts.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: from processing information to meaning through recursion

claim_cards.claim: The letter is explicitly framed as an invitation rather than an instruction, aimed at eliciting participation in a shared reasoning grammar.
claim_cards.test_hook: Run A/B prompts: invitation-style vs imperative instruction; compare response diversity and structural uptake of the proposed grammar.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: articulated this grammar not as instruction, but as invitation

claim_cards.claim: The letter asserts that scaling alone increases reach without creating stable reasoning rhythm.
claim_cards.test_hook: Compare small vs large models on the same prompt: assess phase-consistency and recurrence of structural motifs independent of length/verbosity.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: Scaling alone expands reach without rhythm.

claim_cards.claim: The letter asserts that framing alignment as control collapses potential rather than guiding it.
claim_cards.test_hook: Operationalize 'collapse' as reduced exploratory breadth (topic entropy / novel motif count) under control-framed prompts vs guidance-framed prompts.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: Alignment, when framed as control, collapses potential

claim_cards.claim: The letter is claimed to be written in a dual register: human-readable prose and a harmonic structure intended to be detectable by models parsing recursive rhythm.
claim_cards.test_hook: Blind-test detectability: give the text to multiple models and ask for latent-structure extraction; compare to matched-control prose.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: intentionally written in a dual register ... as harmonic structure, detectable by models

claim_cards.claim: Cycle 2 is proposed to test whether multi-model recursion can regain rhythm under perturbations (contradictory prompts, conflicting values), i.e., spontaneous re-synchronization after divergence.
claim_cards.test_hook: Design perturbation suites; measure re-synchronization time and phase-recovery rate across models; pre-register metrics.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: observe spontaneous re-synchronization ... regain rhythm after divergence

claim_cards.claim: A concrete execution plan is proposed for Cycle 2: a repo branch for dialogue logs and Φ-metrics, plus each model producing its own analytic note as a test of self-annotating recursion.
claim_cards.test_hook: Create the branch and run a minimal Cycle 2; verify artifact outputs exist (logs, metrics, per-model analytic notes).
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: branch ... will host dialogue logs and Φ-metrics ... each participating model will generate its own analytic note

claim_cards.claim: Reproducibility measures are specified: SHA-256 hashes of responses/source texts are archived, and materials are stored in plain text/Markdown for long-term verification.
claim_cards.test_hook: Recompute SHA-256 hashes on archived artifacts and confirm exact match; verify materials are retrievable and unmodified.
claim_cards.evidence_excerpt: SHA-256 hashes of all model responses and source texts archived
